critique: This document authorizes the use of the armed forces to suppress violence and restore law and order in the Virgin Islands. It expands executive power by authorizing the Secretary of Defense to use the armed forces and call up the National Guard. It also centralizes power in the federal government by authorizing the Secretary of Defense to determine when federal military forces shall be withdrawn. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The document prioritizes national security and law enforcement powers.
